Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Fragment of a decorated block
Description: Like several other examples kept at Lille, this fragment of a decorated block comes from the Temple of Ramesses II at Aksha. The decoration preserved on this block depicts the back of the head of the king (?), facing right, which is broken at shoulder level. The face has disappeared. Behind the figure, two fragments of inscribed columns are preserved.
